alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Mercer; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 07 at 6:48AM EST until January 07 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Virginia and southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With temperatures dropping, hazardous travel is possible this where precipitation fell overnight. Use caution when traveling. Northwest winds will gust up to 40 mph along the ridges this morning, which will result in blowing and drifting snow and reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory is issued when strong winds will combine with cold temperatures for several hours to create dangerously cold conditions for exposed skin. Use caution while outside and bring pets inside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greenbrier; Mercer; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier
